rpMergeSBML’s Documentation¶

Indices and tables¶

Introduction¶

Welcome to the rpMergeSBML documentation. This project merges two or more SBMLs or rpSBMLs to a SBML file. The program checks for each species against all the possible species in the target SBML, and selects the closest member. If no match is found, the species is created in the target SBML. The groups are also merged together or created if they do not exist in the target.

Usage¶

First build the rpBase and rpCache dockers before building the local one:

docker build -t brsynth/rpmergesbml-standalone:v2 .

The docker can be called locally using the following command:

python run.py -input_sbml input_sbml.xml -output_sbml output_sbml.xml

API¶

class rpTool.mergeSBML_hdd¶

Merge one or more SBML files together

Parameters

  • input_tar (str) – The path of the TAR input containing the SBML file

  • target_sbml (str :type output_tar: str) – The path of the SBML file to merge to :param output_tar: The path of the TAR output file

Return type

bool

Returns

The success or failure of the function

class rpToolServe.main¶

Merge one or more SBML files together

Parameters

  • source (str) – The path of the TAR or SBML input containing the SBML file

  • inout_format – The format input of the source (Valid Options: [tar, sbml])

  • target_sbml (str) – The path of the SBML file to merge to

  • output (str) – The path of the TAR or SBML output file

Return type

None

Returns

None

class run.main¶

Merge two SBML files or a collection of SBML files in the form of a TAR and another SBML file

Parameters

  • sourcefile (str) – The path of the TAR or SBML input containing the SBML file

  • inout_format (str) – The format input of the source (Valid Options: [tar, sbml])

  • target_sbml (str) – The path of the SBML file to merge to

  • output (str) – The path to the output file

Return type

None
